alert.note: Alert for Minnehaha (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 14 at 10:00AM MDT until April 19 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in South Dakota...Minnesota... James River at Huron affecting Beadle County. West Fork Des Moines River near Avoca affecting Cottonwood and Murray Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Dakota...Iowa... James River near Forestburg affecting Sanborn County. Big Sioux River below Dell Rapids affecting Minnehaha County. Big Sioux River above Hawarden affecting Sioux, Lincoln and Union Counties. Big Sioux River near Egan affecting Moody County. Big Sioux River near Richland affecting Plymouth and Union Counties. Big Sioux River at Brandon affecting Lincoln, Minnehaha and Lyon Counties. Big Sioux River near Estelline affecting Brookings and Hamlin Counties. Big Sioux River at Sioux Falls I-90 affecting Minnehaha County. Big Sioux River near Bruce affecting Brookings County. Big Sioux River at Akron affecting Plymouth and Union Counties. Big Sioux River near Brookings affecting Moody and Brookings Counties. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Iowa... Rock River at Rock Rapids affecting Lyon County. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Big Sioux River below Dell Rapids. * WHEN...Until Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, agricultural lands along the lower banks of the river begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM CDT Friday the stage was 12.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:30 AM CDT Friday was 12.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 12.5 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Big Sioux River Dell Rapids 12.0 12.3 Fri 9 am 12.5 12.5 12.3 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning.
